_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 17:01:11 using v2.0
title: How many days in total are patients delayed and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary: The total number of days that patients are delayed fluctuates month by month but this has been around a fairly stable average with a total of 109,918 delayed days in August 2010, compared to a total of 112,283 delayed days in July 2013. Given that there have been fewer patients being delayed, we assume that there is an increase in the average length of delays â€“ though fewer people are waiting they are waiting longer.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
